summary: This is an email chain from October 6, 2021, discussing the organization and transfer of case materials (sorted into '3500' folders) between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the FBI New York Field Office, and the NYPD. The communication involves troubleshooting file uploads and referencing a manifest of materials related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Case Material Organization and Transfer
events.description: A contractor for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) sorts case materials into '3500' folders and creates a manifest. An email chain documents attempts to transfer these materials to FBI and NYPD personnel, involving troubleshooting an empty zip file and discussing upload methods like USAfx.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 6, 2021, showing ongoing case management related to the Epstein investigation years after his death.
Case materials are being organized into specific '3500' folders, which typically refer to materials discoverable under Rule 3500 of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure (Jencks Act material).
The communication involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS), the FBI's New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk), and the NYPD.
The emails focus on the logistical challenge of transferring a large set of files, including a manifest, and troubleshooting an empty zip file.
The document reference 'EFTA00018853' suggests it is part of a larger series of documents related to the Epstein case.
